basics.name: Tamas L. Nagy
basics.label: Postdoctoral Scholar
basics.summary: A researcher in the field of stem cell biology and systems biology. Interested in collective cellular coordination and cellular perception, particularly how signaling networks interact between cells.

work.name: Department of Neurology, University of California, Los Angeles
work.summary: LLHF Fellow with Thomas A Rando, M.D., Ph.D.

education.area:
Physiology: Modern Cell Biology Using Microscopic, Biochemical and Computational Approaches.

Course Directors: Amy Gladfelter, Ph.D., Cliff Braggwynne, Ph.D.
Rotation Advisors: Cliff Braggwynne, Ph.D.,Stephan Grill, Ph.D., Manu Prakash, Ph.D.

Thesis: Neutrophils actively swell to potentiate rapid migration.
Advisor: Orion D. Weiner, Ph.D.

education.studyType: BS in Mathematical Sciences, BS in Chemistry

awards.title: Postdoctoral Fellowship
awards.awarder: Larry L. Hillblom Foundation, Sonoma, CA
awards.summary: 3 year competitive fellowship for original, independent research ($225,000)

awards.title: Moritz-Heyman Discovery Fellow
awards.summary: 3 year internal grant, served as an ambassador for the Bioinformatics Program ($6,000)

awards.title: AMGEN/CSRB Fellow
awards.summary: Competitive summer REU with Jennifer Doudna, Ph.D.

awards.title: Otis A. Singletary Scholarship
awards.summary: Tuition, board, and stipend covered for four years
